it.polimi.dima.mediatracker.fragments

Class FormAbstractFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.dima.mediatracker.fragments.FormAbstractFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FormCategoryFragment, FormMediaItemAbstractFragment

    public abstract class FormAbstractFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract fragment that manages a form to add/edit "something" in the database

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  FormAbstractFragment.FormExitListener
      Listener for exiting from the form
      static interface  FormAbstractFragment.OnObjectSaveListener
      Listener that receives an event each time a media item is saved in the form

      • manageExitFromForm

        public void manageExitFromForm(FormAbstractFragment.FormExitListener formExitListener)
        Called whenever the user tries to exit from a form (e.g. back pressed). Checks if unsaved changed were made
        Parameters:
        formExitListener - the listener receiving the exit result

      • canExitForm

        protected abstract boolean canExitForm()
        Checks if the user can exit the form (no unsaved changes)
        Returns:
        true if the user can exit the form

      • resetInputUpdatedByUserFlags

        protected abstract void resetInputUpdatedByUserFlags()
        Resets the "wasChangedByUser" flags in all the form inputs

      • getContentLayout

        protected abstract int getContentLayout()
        Returns the form content layout
        Returns:
        content layout resource id

      • setObjectValuesFromInputs

        protected abstract void setObjectValuesFromInputs()
        Retrieves all values from the inputs and sets them in the model object

      • validateObject

        protected abstract java.lang.String validateObject()
        Checks if the form object is correct. Called after setObjectValuesFromInputs() so that the model object already has all the fields set
        Returns:
        null if the object is ok, a string containing the error message otherwise

      • saveObject

        protected abstract void saveObject()
        Saves the model object somewhere. Called after setObjectValuesFromInputs() (the model object already has all the fields set) and only if validateObject() returns null

      • setOnObjectSaveListener

        public void setOnObjectSaveListener(FormAbstractFragment.OnObjectSaveListener onObjectSaveListener)
        Setter
        Parameters:
        onObjectSaveListener - the listener that receives the save events
